isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION WITH WTEC III ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - CHECK TRANS LIGHT

svcproc.title: CHECK TRANS LIGHT
svcproc.para: The Check Trans light, located in the instrument cluster, receives ignition voltage from 5A fuse F6 on circuits 28 and 28A at connector (26)/pin 1. The Check Trans light ground circuit goes through connector (26)/pin 2, circuit 92, connector (377), circuit 115, connector (418), circuit 115, and ECU connector (634)/pin 31.
Thus the ECU can switch pin 31 to ground causing the Check Trans light to illuminate, or remove the ground causing the light to turn off, in response to system commands from the WTEC III ECU.
